clues.text: In a novel by Herman Wouk, unstable Captain Queeg of the USS Caine faces this title event
In Wouk's "Aurora Dawn" from 1947, a young man works in this broadcast medium; Wouk lived to write a book partly in e-mails
"The Winds of War" begins with "Pug" Henry made U.S. military attaché in this European city, sensing the winds of war indeed
In a '50s bestseller Wouk's heroine Marjorie Morgenstern anglicizes her last name to this & seeks fame as an actress
Physicist Guy Carpenter is out of a job in "A Hole in Texas", based on the real cancellation of the Superconducting this machine

rounds.comments: (Ken: Each correct response will end with the letters"T-H-E".)

clues.text: To feel intense dislike
To alleviate or provide solace
To fancy up an argument with big words, or to array with garments
To be filled with violent emotion, perhaps rage
Happy & lighthearted, like a title spirit in a classic Noël Coward play
In 1985 Apple's board gave this guy the heave-ho but 12 years later he got ho-heaved & was back in charge
A rough New Year's Day in 1959 for Fulgencio Batista, who woke up as president of this country & went to sleep as an exile
Getting the supreme boot in Genesis, he was told, "a fugitive and a vagabond shalt thou be"
This Bolshevik got exiled to Siberia twice, expelled from the Politburo in 1926 & the Soviet Union itself 3 years later
Elected to Congress from Tennessee in 1833 as an Anti-Jacksonian, he got the boot in the 1834 election & headed off to Texas
This branch of the U.S. government makes the laws
Keep your eye on the birdie, also known by this longer name
Another word for the draft, it's mandatory enrollment in the military
This word meaning "nonsense" begins with the name of a son of Odin
This term for a tightrope walker comes from Latin for "rope" & "walk"
David stood upon this "Philistine, and took his sword... and cut off his head therewith"
In Exodus, "Behold", this "burned with fire, and (it) was not consumed"
"And when he had opened the fourth seal... I looked, and behold a pale" this: "and his name that sat on him was Death"
As Jesus "walked by" this body of water, "he saw Simon and Andrew his brother casting a net into the sea: for they were fishers"
Since no one had done this for 40 years, God told Joshua to get a knife & do it to the male Israelites

This Asian country, not yet divided into North & South:
From France, 1945

Angola:
1975, from this country

This country:
1971, from Pakistan

Belgium:
1830, from this country

Montenegro:
2006, ending a union with this other Yugoslav republic
This Oklahoma town was named for U.S. Representative Wesley, not animation king Walt
There's a reindeer barn at Santa's workshop in this appropriately named New York hamlet, not far from Lake Placid
I like Big Butt Trail & I cannot lie, you other brothers can't deny it's fun to hike it near Asheville in this state
Self-styled as West Virginia's first town, it dates to 1762 & shares its name with a 2012 presidential nominee
Alabama? That's a town in New York State centrally located between Rochester & this seat of Erie County
There's plain this flavor, the epitome of plain, as well as French this & this bean
In 2020 this brand of ice cream bars celebrated 100 years of putting everyone into a better mood
McDonald's has the McFlurry, & Dairy Queen has this signature treat blended with cookies or candies
The logo of this ice cream brand includes rabbit ears & a tail on the letter "B"
A teen named Lina is in Tuscany for the summer in Jenna Evans Welch's novel called "Love &" this Italian ice cream
Huck Finn was introduced in this novel
Stephenie Meyer said the idea for this first novel came to her in a dream
The nameless narrator of this, Wells' first novel, finds himself in the year 802,701
Jim Hawkins is the boy hero & narrator of this novel
This novel by F. Scott Fitzgerald tells of the troubled marriage of Dick & Nicole Diver
1821's "Three Guarantees" were independence, equality of Spaniards & Creoles & supremacy of this religion
From the 1940s to the 1960s, millions of Mexicans known as braceros got temporary U.S. permits to work in this sector
Selected for development using a computer, this Yucatan city got its first hotel in 1974 & is now Mexico's No. 1 beach resort
The era of this man's late 19th & early 20th century rule is known as the Porfiriato
This 1860s presidente & national hero gave his name to a ciudad along Mexico's border with Texas
In the opera "Dead Man Walking", Sister Helen meets her pen pal, a death row inmate, at Angola Penitentiary in this state
Philip Glass' "Akhnaten" begins in Thebes with the passing of Amenhotep III & words sung from this tome
This composer set "Die Meistersinger von Nürnberg" in a city south of his birthplace, Leipzig
"Nabucco", based on the life of Nebuchadnezzar, features a scene in this city's gardens
A Strauss opera has this title princess "auf Naxos", abandoned by Theseus after she helped him escape the Labyrinth
Ovid's "Ars Amatoria", translated as "Art of" this, led to charges of immorality
In this fittingly titled Ovid work, Ascalaphus is punished by being transformed into an owl
Ovid's tragedy about this enchantress who helped Jason with the Golden Fleece was praised in the poet's day but is now lost
Coming under the scrutiny of Augustus, Ovid was punished with a type of this called relegation
In an Ovid work, "Why are We Joined in Soul, and Parted by the Wave?" asks this paramour of Hero

rounds.text: Both of the names of these 2 lovers in a Shakespeare play come from Latin words for "blessed"
